channel.title: Help with .P files
channel.description: What do you use to edit/modify .P files, I recently decided to Try out a 721 Source (Zenithscape) and i Have yet to find something to open them in Any help is much appreciated. Thank you.

item.title: Help with .P files
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

ljay wilson:

Well, I went into Data/Characters/My Character Open Ill post a pic as soon as possible. I opened in notepad, And Notepad++ Still is crazy looking. Might just give up on Zenith TBH to much work on top of all the bugs,

The character files are stored as raw data… You’ll have to figure out how the server saves it if you want to decode them

Read full topic

item.title: Help with .P files
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Kamran1:

They are pascal scripted files, these contain binary listings inside, find a pascal program

None of these servers have anything to do with Pascal. You can’t use the file extension to determine format.

@OP: Where are the files located in relation to the server root? You can try to edit them with notepad to see if they’re in plain text format. If not you’ll have to look through the server to reverse engineer the format

Read full topic
